definitions.definition: The univalent hydrocarbon radical, CH 3 -, formally derived from methane by the loss of a hydrogen atom; a compound or part of a compound formed by the attachment of such a radical.

main_definition: ( organic chemistry ) The univalent hydrocarbon radical, CH 3 -, formally derived from methane by the loss of a hydrogen atom; a compound or part of a compound formed by the attachment of such a radical.
